meanings.definition: To bury (a dead body) in the ground.
meanings.sent1: The family sadly inhumed their beloved pet in the backyard.
meanings.sent2: The villagers inhumed the deceased elder in the local cemetery.
meanings.sent3: The children inhumed their goldfish in a tiny coffin made of matchsticks.
meanings.sent4: The memories of her past were inhumed deep within her heart.
meanings.sent5: The ancient tradition of inhuming the dead has been practiced for centuries.

meanings.definition: To inter (a dead body) in a grave or tomb.
meanings.sent1: They inhumed the pharaoh's body in a grand pyramid.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers solemnly inhumed their fallen comrade with military honors.
meanings.sent3: The pirates inhumed their treasure chest on a deserted island.
meanings.sent4: The secrets of the ancient civilization were inhumed beneath layers of sand.
meanings.sent5: The mystery novel inhumed clues throughout its pages for the readers to discover.
